reviews.text: I did not stay, I was only a day guest, using the pool, and hot spa for the day. I have been many times, and the service is excellent everytime. Helpful staff, good food and it is a clean hotel.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Town

reviews.text: Since the only Westerners that goto Ranong are people who work or live there, or the few (increasing everday) visa runners to Burma, it is to be expected that people there would not speak the best English. Further, the majority of customers are Thais from Bangkok, but this doesn't mean the locals hate Westerners. There are many restaurants serving Western food, and Western beer, a pub which, alright, no Western music, but is fun, more 7-11s than you can shake a stick at, and an airport (recently reopened using AirAsia, not Phuket air as was), and many bus links to and from Bangkok/Phuket. The nearest train station is Chumporn, which is between 1-2 hours awayby bus.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Stay away like the plague
reviews.text: The hotel as I understand it does not class itself as 5*, but rather as 4*, but for as little as 20-25 GBP, I think your perspective is that of a tourist that expects perfection found in Europe.
